title: bbsTaiwan
text: Hello, birder! Taiwan Breeding Bird Survey (BBS) conducts annual surveys, providing valuable systematic dataset studying species trends. bbsTaiwan package designed make accessing using precious Taiwan BBS data easier. article, aim demonstrate general applications can perform package. Enjoy coding birdies!

title: bbsTaiwan
text: diving bird occurrence data, ’s helpful first understand surveys conducted. includes knowing number sites, locations, number sites surveyed year. bbsTaiwan package provides several functions help get started understanding surveying effort. see number sites surveyed year, can use bbs_history() function. function type argument two options: "plot" "table". Selecting "plot" display results ggplot graph, "table" show results tibble. Additionally, bbs_plotmap() function can used visualize distribution particular species. set argument NULL, display locations sites surveyed historically.  prefer work tables see values directly, bbsTaiwan covered! can use bbs_history() function "table" option view number sites surveyed year tabular format. Additionally, can use bbs_sites() function access complete list sites plots along coordinates.

title: bbsTaiwan
text: Now come core function bbs_fetch(). function retrieves bird occurrence data GBIF summarizes understandable format. original data format GBIF, includes event occurrence data, designed machine-readable can difficult humans interpret. bbs_fetch() addresses performing following key steps: Join: Combines event, occurrence, measurementorfacts datasheets GBIF single cohesive dataset. Filter: Retains observations specified species using target_species argument. Zero Fill: Converts implicit missing values explicit ones filling zeros trips target species observed. Specifically, plot visited particular year trip target species observed, species count show value 0 row. Finding hard choose specific target species want access entire dataset species? One great features bbs_fetch() can set target_species = "全部" retrieve entire unfiltered dataset.
code: # Here is a list of the 32 endemic bird species in Taiwan, where the species name can be used as the input of the function. #  # c("黑長尾雉", "白眉林鴝", "黃腹琉璃", "灰鷽", "小翼鶇", "白頭鶇", "赤腹山雀", "台灣竹雞", "繡眼畫眉", "台灣朱雀", "棕噪眉", "褐頭花翼", "台灣鷦眉", "小彎嘴", "大彎嘴", "台灣白喉噪眉", "台灣畫眉", "五色鳥", "台灣叢樹鶯", "火冠戴菊鳥", "烏頭翁", "台灣紫嘯鶇", "栗背林鴝", "黃山雀", "台灣藍鵲", "黃胸藪眉", "紋翼畫眉", "冠羽畫眉", "台灣噪眉", "白耳畫眉", "台灣山鷓鴣", "藍腹鷴")  bbs_fetch(target_species = "白頭翁") #> # A tibble: 53,874 × 16 #>     year month   day site   locationID decimalLatitude decimalLongitude weather #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>   #>  1  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  2  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  3  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  4  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  5  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  6  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  7  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. NA      #>  8  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. NA      #>  9  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. NA      #> 10  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. title: bbsTaiwan
text: Viewing distribution species (.e., sites certain species observed) straightforward. Simply use bbs_plotmap() function specify species interested . function can handle 5 species time prevent plot becoming cluttered.

title: bbsTaiwan
text: satisfied default functionality provided bbsTaiwan? additional steps can take beyond package offers: need summarize data customized way ready dive data wrangling, consider using raw data available GBIF repository. Working directly raw data allows fully understand data cleaning process create customized data structure tailored study objectives. raw data Darwin Core format can accessed easily using names relevant spreadsheets. data objects automatically loaded install package.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sunny Tseng. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tseng S (2024). bbsTaiwan: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval Analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/SunnyTseng/bbsTaiwan, https://sunnytseng.github.io/bbsTaiwan/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bbsTaiwan: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis},   author = {Sunny Tseng},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/SunnyTseng/bbsTaiwan},   url = {https://sunnytseng.github.io/bbsTaiwan/}, }

title: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis
text: goal bbsTaiwan streamline retrieval analysis Taiwan Breeding Bird Survey (BBS) data. package facilitates data access GBIF, Taiwan BBS data stored. data openly available GBIF, complex arrangement Darwin Core format can make challenging understand use, often requiring advanced data wrangling skills. bbsTaiwan package designed simplify process, making easier access utilize Taiwan BBS data. project supported rOpenSci Champions Program 2023-2024, Sunny Tseng main developer Eunseop Kim mentor. Jerome Ko kindly assisted interpreting accessing Taiwan BBS data. Get started Black Bulbul case study

title: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis
text: v1.0.0 (Initial Release): Developed based GBIF Taiwan BBS dataset v1.9, covers data 2009 2016.

title: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis
text: can install load development version bbsTaiwan Github :

title: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis
text: bbsTaiwan provides several intuitive imported datasets data processing functions. perform basic data retrieval visualization: bbs_history() examine number BBS sites surveyed year bbs_sites() return coordinates BBS sites bbs_fetch() fetch cleaned version Taiwan BBS cccurrence data species bbs_plotmap() visualize species distribution across BBS sites bbs_translate() translate bird species’ Chinese common name scientific name accessing raw Taiwan BBS dataset GBIF: occurrence: times locations particular species recorded event: protocols used, sample size, location measurementorfacts: additional information relating events extendedmeasurementorfact: additional information relating taxon occurrences

title: Streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) Data Retrieval and Analysis
code: library(bbsTaiwan)  ## Get data for species of interest bbs_fetch(c("白頭翁", "烏頭翁")) #> # A tibble: 92,475 × 16 #>     year month   day site   locationID decimalLatitude decimalLongitude weather #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>   #>  1  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  2  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  3  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  4  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  5  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  6  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  7  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_01             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  8  2009     4    26 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. <NA>    #>  9  2009     3    10 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. <NA>    #> 10  2009     4     5 A02-01 A02-01_02             25.1             122. <NA>    #> # ℹ 92,465 more rows #> # ℹ 8 more variables: wind <chr>, habitat <chr>, scientificName <chr>, #> #   vernacularName <chr>, individualCount <dbl>, time_slot <chr>, #> #   distance <chr>, flock <chr>  ## Find the distribution/overlap of two species bbs_plotmap(c("白頭翁", "烏頭翁"))

what: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: function fetches occurrence data specified target species, utilizing event occurrence tables GBIF. fetched dataset undergoes following processing steps: Join: Combines event, occurrence, measurementorfacts datasheets GBIF single cohesive dataset. Filter: Retains observations specified species using target_species argument. entered Chinese common name linked scientific name bbs_translate. Zero Fill: Converts implicit missing values explicit ones filling zeros trips target species observed. Specifically, plot visited particular year trip target species observed, species count show value 0 row.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: target_species Character string specifying Chinese common name species interest. can accept single character string, target_species = "紅嘴黑鵯", vector, target_species = c("紅嘴黑鵯", "白耳畫眉").Use "全部" return species.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: tibble containing species occurrence data.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch

The bird is not in the BBS species list #> ! 查無鳥名 #> NULL

what: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: function returns number sites surveyed year BBS Taiwan project. Sites mapped five regions: East, West, South, North, Mountain (elevation higher 1,000 m).

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: type Character string specifying output format: either "table" "plot". Default value type = "plot"

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: tibble ggplot showing number sites surveyed year across regions.

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
code: # Return the number of sites in a table bbs_history(type = "table") #> # A tibble: 8 × 6 #>   year   East Mountain North  West Others #>   <chr> <int>    <int> <int> <int>  <int> #> 1 2009     31       41    24    52      0 #> 2 2010     30       26    25    57      2 #> 3 2011     24       37    55   134      3 #> 4 2012     31       47    88   142      3 #> 5 2013     28       43    80   138      2 #> 6 2014     36       46    91   118      2 #> 7 2015     36       49   112   143     12 #> 8 2016     38       42    98   157      2  # Return the number of sites in a bar chart bbs_history(type = "plot")

what: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: function visualizes sites surveyed breeding birds Taiwan, highlighting presence absence specific species. designed upon function bbs_fetch bbs_translate.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: target_species Character string specifying scientific name species interest. can accept single character string, target_species = "紅嘴黑鵯", vector, target_species = c("紅嘴黑鵯", "白耳畫眉"). function can accept plotting 5 species one figure. Use NULL return map site distribution.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: ggplot object showing distribution map.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
code: # For single species distribution bbs_plotmap(target_species = "紅嘴黑鵯")   # For multiple species distribution bbs_plotmap(target_species = c("紅嘴黑鵯", "白耳畫眉"))   # Simply the distribution of the surveyed sites bbs_plotmap(target_species = NULL)

what: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: function returns coordinates BBS sites surveyed. arguments needed. coordinates reported using WGS84 projection system. Use terra::vect(geom = c("decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude"), crs = "epsg:4326") transform table spatial object.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: tibble including coordinates BBS survey sites, WGS84.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: source data comes event table GBIF dataset.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
code: # Get the full list of BBS sites in a tibble bbs_sites() #> # A tibble: 4,160 × 6 #>    site   plot  locationID locality   decimalLatitude decimalLongitude #>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>      <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1 A02-01 01    A02-01_01  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  2 A02-01 02    A02-01_02  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  3 A02-01 03    A02-01_03  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  4 A02-01 04    A02-01_04  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  5 A02-01 05    A02-01_05  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  6 A02-01 06    A02-01_06  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  7 A02-01 07    A02-01_07  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  8 A02-01 08    A02-01_08  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #>  9 A02-01 09    A02-01_09  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #> 10 A02-01 10    A02-01_10  台北縣瑞芳            25.1             122. #> # ℹ 4,150 more rows  # Transform BBS sites into a spatial object using terra package bbs_sites() |> terra::vect(geom = c("decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude"), crs = "epsg:4326") #>  class       : SpatVector  #>  geometry    : points  #>  dimensions  : 4160, 4  (geometries, attributes) #>  extent      : 21.94431, 25.27016, 120.0673, 121.9298  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #>  coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #>  names       :   site  plot locationID   locality #>  type        :  <chr> <chr>      <chr>      <chr> #>  values      : A02-01    01  A02-01_01 台北縣瑞芳 #>                A02-01    02  A02-01_02 台北縣瑞芳 #>                A02-01    03  A02-01_03 台北縣瑞芳

what: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: function intended use bbs_fetch bbs_plotmap. function helps users find scientific names birds Chinese common names species found Taiwan.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: target_species single character string vector character strings representing species' names Chinese.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: vector bird species' scientific names. input species name included bird list Taiwan, NA returned. Please check typos.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
code: # For a single species bbs_translate("白頭翁") #> [1] "Pycnonotus sinensis"  # For multiple species bbs_translate(target_species = c("烏頭翁", "白頭翁", "紅嘴黑鵯", "白耳畫眉")) #> [1] "Pycnonotus taivanus"      "Pycnonotus sinensis"      #> [3] "Hypsipetes leucocephalus" "Heterophasia auricularis"
